questions.question: What are the two main functions of preverbs in Georgian?
questions.explanation: Preverbs serve two main functions: they indicate directionality (where the action moves) and mark aspect (perfective vs imperfective).

questions.question: ვწერ [vts'er] demonstrates which aspect?
questions.explanation: ვწერ [vts'er] has no preverb, which indicates imperfective aspect - the action is ongoing or habitual.

questions.question: დავწერ [davts'er] demonstrates which aspect?
questions.explanation: დავწერ [davts'er] has the preverb და- [da-], indicating perfective aspect - the action will be completed.

questions.question: What direction does the preverb მი- [mi-] indicate?
questions.explanation: The preverb მი- [mi-] indicates directionality TOWARD something or someone.

questions.question: What direction does the preverb გა- [ga-] typically indicate?
questions.explanation: The preverb გა- [ga-] typically indicates directionality OUT or AWAY FROM something.

questions.question: Match the preverbs to their meanings:
questions.explanation: Remember: მი- toward, გა- out/away, აკ- up, ჩაკ- into.

questions.question: Which sentence means 'I will write the book' (and complete it)?
questions.explanation: დავწერ [davts'er] uses the და- [da-] preverb for perfective aspect, meaning 'I will write and complete the book.'

questions.question: In the sentence: ის მივიდა ოთახში [is mivida otakhshi], what does the preverb მი- indicate?

options.text: He went out of the room
He went up to the room
He went down to the room

questions.explanation: მივიდა [mivida] uses preverb მი- [mi-] which means 'toward.' Combined with ოთახში [otakhshi] 'in the room,' it means 'went toward/into the room.'
